alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hamilton; Marshall; Story (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Story, western Marshall, northeastern Boone and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 146 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nevada, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Ames, Nevada, Story City, State Center, Roland, Gilbert, Iowa State Center, Maxwell, Colo, Melbourne, Zearing, Albion, Collins, McCallsburg, Rhodes, Clemons, St. Anthony and Ames Municipal Airport. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 108 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
